email.subject: Call for Papers: Responsible AI Special Issue Journal - Information Processing & Management

call_for_papers.title: Responsible Artificial Intelligence: Methodologies, Implications, and Practices

special_issue_information.description: This special issue seeks to bring together cutting-edge research, methodologies, and critical reflections on Responsible Artificial Intelligence (RAI). The issue aims to deepen our understanding of the ethical, legal, technical, and societal dimensions of AI systems.
special_issue_information.importance: As AI technologies permeate decision-making across industry, government, and society, the demand for systems that are fair, accountable, transparent, and trustworthy has never been more urgent.
special_issue_information.purpose: This special issue will provide a dedicated venue for interdisciplinary contributions addressing key challenges and opportunities in designing, deploying, and governing responsible AI systems.

possible_topics: Fairness and Bias Mitigation in AI
Sociotechnical and Cultural Dimensions of AI

types_of_submissions.description: We invite original, high-quality submissions that contribute substantively to the field of Responsible AI.
examples: Research articles with empirical findings, theoretical contributions, or methodological innovations
Review articles offering comprehensive surveys of specific sub-areas within responsible AI

submission_guidelines.peer_review_process: Single-blind peer-review process coordinated by the guest editors in coordination with the IP&M EiC.
submission_guidelines.overlapping_publications: Authors must disclose any overlapping publications and provide clear documentation of changes in revised submissions.

contact.name: Calvin Hillis
contact.position: Program Coordinator - Responsible Development of Artificial Intelligence
